name: McPixel
description: McPixel is a save-the-day guy that you guide through 100 short challenges to prevent stuff from blowing up. You have only 20 seconds to save the day! Think quick!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Processor:Intel Pentium 4 or AMD Athlon 64 Memory:512 MB RAM Graphics:Pixel-art capable graphics card DirectX®:9.0b Hard Drive:70 MB HD space Sound:Stereo sound card
recommended_requirements: OS:Windows Vista Processor:Intel Core 2 Duo or Athlon X2 Memory:1024 MB RAM Graphics:Pixel-art-with-filters capable graphics card DirectX®:9.0b Hard Drive:71 MB HD space Sound:Stereo sound card

reviews.review_text: When in doubt aim for the crotch and pee on explosives.

This game has it all. Pixels, explosions, stopping explosions, and urinating in a space ship's engine. In this point and click game, you choose very basic commands and McPixel does them by clicking an object, or clicking one object, then clicking another. You can never really know what he is going to do or if it will solve the level, but that's not the point. The point is that you get to see him stick an electric razor up his ♥♥♥ and rub it on Batman's face.
Mindblowing game!! nothing more nothing less.
This game is awesome, I just love it. It's a little short but it worth the price. You'll get like 3 hours of headache trying to solve this.

This is a silly, silly point-and-click game where you try to figure out how to stop a bomb from exploding through trial and error. The graphics are intentionally (I think?) super crude, and the interactions between you (McPixel) and world objects are surreal and unpredictable, which gives the game its charm and character. The game wisely advises you to play it in short sittings and take breaks. Indeed, I found if I played more than one set of levels at a time the humor would kind of wear off, and since this game relies entirely on its humor, it stopped being fun very quickly. But then when I played it the next day it'd be fresh again. Some drawbacks: The music is repetitive; the graphics are overly crude, so much so that you can't always tell a clickable object exists; there's no achievements (I'm a little OCD so I like achievements). I think it's a little pricey at $5, but I bought it on sale so I think it was definitely worth whatever it was I paid. All in all, it's a quirky, silly game that   changes the entire genre   will put a smile on your face.
its rad but used to be only one dollar now its five....hmmm...worth it? sure why not
This game will change your life forever!
pew djke pire playd it so it good gaem pls lik and favorit tehe vidio and subscrieb brofist pe ce ot by

It's a fantastic virtual experience, deep history, superb gameplay, beautiful graphics, majestic music, in short, an incredible journey for all people who love video games

The solution, to, 'disarm the Volcano', which said 'INSERT VIRGIN' on it, was, to throw MYSELF in it. LOL  So much win. Get this game.  A truly unique and special game. Anyone with a sense of humor, and, an enjoyment for problem solving, needs to at least try this game. So hard to explain, and so much more fun than pictures and trailers can explain. This is not a cheap product. It's a crude, well thought out, hilarious game, with awful graphics on purpose, that you should enjoy, yesterday

Incredibly stupid gameplay mixed with incredible stupid puzzle solutions - you've got the best puzzle game of 2013! McPixel is a fast paced humorous mini-puzzle game, where our main hero McPixel (an obvious reference to Macgyver) tries in 20 seconds to defuse a bomb and save the day. Everything is controlled with one mouse button and that's where it's charm lies. To use or pick up an item you just press it. And hope for the best. Sometimes pressing something (or someone) will pick that thing or even a person up to use with other items. In other cases, pressing will lead to McPixel kicking the said item or person. Usually that kick will result in everything blowing up. Sometimes the solution is to press on the fire to take your pants off and take a ♥♥♥♥, saving everyone's life. Pressing the fire in the next puzzle will make McPixel jump to the fire, combusting himself. In the third puzzle, pressing the bomb will make McPixel kick it, destroying half the city. The solutions range from simply press the fire extinguisher to extinguish bomb to kick a fat naked guy in the showers, so that he would slip on the soap and land on a bomb, defusing it. Every single solutions is stupid, yet brilliant at the same time. It also offers FREE DLC, a thing that you wouldn't get in a 60$ 'realistic millitary shooter'. And for a such a minimal price, you'd be an idiot not to try this game out. RECOMMENDED TO BUY.
Crack. Puzzling solving crack. Not for the faint of heart, young of age, or sane of mind.

Definitley the best super hero game of all time. Batman and Deadpool can go home now. Next gen point and click gameplay as well as innovative moral choices (like urinating on explosives or using said explosives to set fire to an old man) make this masterpiece truly glorious.  10/10 would save the world again.
Basically take Monkey Island. And add a lot more humor. Now double that. Now take the game's length and quarter it. Then do it again. There, you have McPixel.

Buy? Maybe. (My experience is based on the Android version) McPixel is a very stupid minigame-fest, where you must save the day by preventing a bomb from exploding in a variety of 20 scenarios. The idea is a sort of comedy based, retro-style take on MacGuyver, where you improvise a way to stop a bomb from exploding. This includes stuffing bombs into people, causing somebody to accidentally kick the bomb out, or straight up urniating on the bomb. The comedy overtly crude and immature, and probably the reason for it's popularity of 'Let's Play' videos with the younger audience. There are a few moments of laughs for me, especially the 'Insert Virigin' mission.  It's point and click adventure gameplay will unfairly throw people off - unlike most adventure games where you may find yourself stuck without a guide, this is the only adventure point and click I know of where there is a constant failure state built in either the 20 second time limit of each level or in your inability to find the right answer. Plus, the extreme simplicity of the controls where you can either click to interact or swipe/right click to skip removes unnecessary complexity from the genre. Yes, it's a tad annoying to fail, but it's over quickly and since you can only click on so few things, you will eventually find the answer. This alone makes this game worth playing or at least checking out to people with huge backlogs - the game is very short (3-5hrs) and it means you can play the game, even mindlessly and be able to finish without scratching your head very often (there are a couple head scratchers though).   There are no sound effects in the entire game beyond the title screen. It's strange how a game about explosions only uses it in the title screen versus the rest of the game. It could have been a conscious decision to let the zany, silly chiptune style music make the situation seem crazy, lazy game design, or possibly both. The biggest legimate annoyance is the humor of the game ♥♥♥♥ jokes, dry humping, crotch kicks - it all sounds like something written by a pre-teen and it will definitely annoy some people. Another very annoying aspect is having to replay level to 'find all the gags' in every level before you can reach the ending. This may offer some entertainment to players that enjoy this comedy, but for everybody else, it's an unnecessary grind, which is accentuated in the irritatingly boring, and unnecessary 'click everything and hope for the best' last level. Still, I'd say the $5 price tag matches the value of the game, though I'm glad I got this in a bundle which made it really cheap - I could say I wasted my time with this game, but I played it on my phone while there was down time at work - wasting time was the whole point.  By the way, I'd argue this game is better in short bursts on a mobile device than sitting down and playng on PC. The only reason why I have 10 hours logged was to farm trading cards - I wouldn't have installed it otherwise.
A very funny game that will entertain you all the day! Even though sometimes there is weird stuff... Anyways, if you like funny/stupid games this is the one!

I remember playing this as a Flash game long ago. The retail version is basically the same with more levels. It's a very Warioware-like game. Every stage you get around 30 seconds to save the day (often by stopping a bomb explosion). While the odds of beating a stage the first time are low, there's usually less than 10 permutations you can do on any given stage, so you'll figure it out quickly.  Similar to Wizorb, perhaps its best feature is how inexpensive it is - under $1 on a sale. Even less than that if it's in a bundle.  If you decide to play and don't feel like reading instructions, just don't forget that SPACE lets you skip just about all animations/intros. It will make your gameplay experience a hundred times better.  I finished most of the content, including seeing most of the gags, in about 3 hours. It was.. somewhat fun, I guess. Might have been better left as a Flash game. Still, I'll give it a 6.5 out of 10. Still recommended, but just barely, and only on a sale or in a bundle. Also, if it matters to you, this game has Steam cards.

If you've ever played one of the Wario Ware or Four Second Frenzy flash games, imagine that in a point-and-click adventure framework with a sense of humor like Spongebob without an age rating limitation. Add explosions every few seconds, and BOOM you get McPixel. It's pretty fun as something of a series of mini-cartoons your first time through levels, and it's good as a microgames style challenge if you challenge Endless Mode.There's free DLC (both user-made and official), a level editor, and a number of unlockables as you go. Definitely worth playing if you like a healthy dose of silly. (And there is an official free version that's not on Steam if you go looking for it and just want to try the game.)

McPixel is a hilarious game in every sense of the word. While the actual gameplay may come off as 'randomly pick the right choice,' The real eye catcher with McPixel is just seeing how many wacky and unexpected scenarios that can unfold when you interact with items and characters. The graphics are depicted as sort of a crude 8-bit design, but that actually works to the game's comedic and random standpoint. And of course the ever present free DLC adds even more comedy and chaos to what is already an outrageous game.  You'll come in for the seemingly impossible challenges, but you'll stay for the laughs and hijynx.

McPixel is a little puzzle game based on visual humour. If you keep finding yourself with nothing to play for a few minutes between other activities, this is it. However, McPixel can get repetitive sometimes and use the same jokes. In addition, you can get a lot of free DLC which increases playtime greatly.

Be forewarned, I am only through the first level of this game, but I am already hooked. This game is gloriously stupid, patently ridiculous, an absolutely hilarious. It's good enough to need three adverbs.  You play as McPixel, I think, who is a MacGuyver/MacGruber type protagonist who only has thirty seconds to stop things from exploding. The gameplay is very simple point and click adventure style, the graphics are old school pixel art, and the music is something you expect from an Atari 2600 title, but all of it works perfectly together.  The puzzles are simple, yet clever. It's worth getting them wrong just for the hilarity of the consequences. I've been slapped by Buddah, had a cow fall in love with me, fed a hot dog to a pot-smoking alien, and made a man poop dynamite in the span of five minutes.   This game is absolutely worth $1.99. I haven't played long enough to know if it's worth the full price, but considering I've already laughed more at this than I would at most modern comedy movies in a theater, I'm going to tentatively say that yes. Yes it is. The developer has been really great about getting the word out about this game by giving out at least a couple hundred copies, and I really hope it pays off. I would definitely play more of his/her stuff.  For a simple, funny, pick-up-an-go game, McPixel delivers. And then explodes. Often. I really can't overstate how many explosions you'll see in this game.

Are you a fan of 'use everything on everything' games? Do you like crude nonsensical humor that includes bodily excretions, indiscriminate humping, and buffoon-flailing? Do you want to reward an indie developer who, upon learning his game was being torrented on The ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, gave out gift codes to the site? Then this game is for you!  The game is actually a mass of mini-games connected by chapters, and will not last you more than an hour, two hours tops. But considering it's price of $5 and often $2.50 during Steam's many sales, it's perfect as a humorous distraction you can play during short intervals! Buy now and defuse bombs the McPixel way!

McPixel is a point-and-click adventure game with a very simple premise: in each stage, prevent a bomb from exploding within 20 seconds. The gameplay usually consists of interacting with various things on the screen and figuring out what the solution is, usually by deduction (there aren't that many possbilities per stage). If you lose, no problem. The pace is pretty quick, so you'll be back in the action soon enough. It's definitely a refreshing take on the genre, sort of like Half-Minute Hero.  A major part of this game is the crude humor. There's a ton of it. This is the sort of game that a 13-year-old boy would love to play but probably shouldn't. That said, I enjoyed the humor quite a bit. When you interact with something, the character normally tries to be a huge jerk. The default interaction with people is to kick them in the groin (male or female). If you're holding something, you'll probably hit them in the face with it too. McPixel rarely does what you expect him to, and that's a lot of what's so funny about the game.  The graphics are bad, but still charming. The music is a little grating. The controls are simple and effective. Keep in mind that this is a short game. I finished it 100% in three hours. Overall, I'd recommend McPixel if you find it cheap, especially for adventure game fans. It's not a bad way to spend an afternoon.

To be honest, I'm not entirely sure how to describe this game. Is it worth the very low price tag? Yeah. When its on sale, it sells for like 50 cents. Its actually pretty hilarious at times. Its a funny point and click game, where the goal is to find the bomb and 'save the day', in some crazy way or another. Its a very dirty game, lots of toilet humor. The graphics are pretty good, sometimes the colors are weird and you aren't able to see things because of extremely subtle shading. But its great for killing time.
this game is messed up, but in a good way

It's silly, it's fast, it's highly and overtly referential, while also somehow (mostly) making pixel hunting sort of entertaining. If you're interested in an absurd, light point and click adventure game, you can't exactly go wrong here. Simply go in expecting to have to retry puzzles several times as you try to click everything to figure out the bizarre logic of the game, but absolutely don't expect any sort of cohesive, profound stories here.   This is a silly absurd romp for those times when you want to see ridiculous things unfold without having to bear through loads of story setup or progression, and in that it's sort of wonderful. It's also somewhat replayable with a few hidden things in each area, as I recall, but these never struck me as worth going after.
A short little time waster, kinda like something you would find on newgrounds but im not gonna complain I got it for less than a dollar.
Save the day.          YouTube™ Video:  McPixel

Very short game that, as a game, fails rather gloriously since it relies on little more than trial & error as you merely click on objects to interact with them. Most of the time it is simply impossible to foresee what might come from clicking on any given object, but this is also where the frun comes from.  Most outcomes are plain absurd and while some gags are rather puerile, they are thrown at you at such a high pace you won't be able to resist smiling.  Despite a high death count the game also manages to never be frustrating as dieing means nothing more than losing maybe five seconds and is rewarded with another silly death animation.  McPixel is a unique experience I'd recommend to anyone to at least try for themselves.
It's a great time waster, if you need one. Not very long either, but that's not really the point. It's cheap right now and there's a ton of dlc, so it might be the opportunity to get it.
Well it's a pretty fun game, spent many hours playing on pirated game.  Disclaimer: It took me almost 3 years to realize I reviewed this game already, and I gave thumbs down. I'm sorry :D
you will never know why and how.. never
McPixel is as simple as it is moronic, is as genious as it is entertaining. Would click the hell out of this game for hours just to see myself lose every level! Best game to have fun losing eheh!

I'm staying neutral on this one. For a dollar - sure. But it's a phone app. Nonetheless - i found it a short, epileptic, humorous and fun trip into a silly, senseless world of pixeled trial and error.

I watched a Let's Play and thought it would be a funny game, but it's only a big trial and error game. When you succeed, the animation is indeed funny, but the path to get there sometimes ruin the moment (and when it doesn't, it's too short anyway compared to the amount of time you spend doing useless and boring tries).  So yeah, go watch a Let's Play instead.

In my 17 years of gaming, never have I come across a game that is so bad. It is basically a point and click game. The aim of the game is to locate and destroy/get rid of a bomb by clicking on objects on the screen. There are several stages which each has several levels.  The good points are that you get lots of levels (100) which you can happily sink alot of time in.   Now for the bad points. First off, although the game tries to be humorous by having you embarass or do terrible things to the characters in the game, some of the actions that the main character does may be offend/disturb people (e.g. peeing on an alien). Second is that when you start the game there is literally no tutorial which was somewhat frustrating trying to figure out what to do. Third issue is that when you fail to locate the bomb, you will proceed to the next level. The game then goes through all five levels of the stage untill you have disarmed the bomb in each stage. This forces you to remember exactly which items not to click on, but the main problem is that it is somewhat difficult to find which items can be interacted with. Fourth issue is that the game is extremely repetitive. Once you finished the first level, all the other levels are exactly the same except with new scenery. Fifth issue is that the music is really annoying as it plays 1 track for the ENTIRE game.  If you like point and click games, avoid this game. If you like a fun and enjoyable games, avoid this game. It isn't even worth $1 let alone $5.
Boring click fest joke game. Would be a good game if it wasn't 'click everything until you don't explode.'. These puzzles for the most part lnvolve luck over logic.
buy it if youre under 12 and you have no sense of humor
Allofmywut.jpg I didn't find this game funny at all....

Personal Rating: 2 of 10  You play a hero named McPixel where your ultimate goal is to save the world (I think). Sounds interesting? Guess again. Each stage has like a few scenarios where you need to randomly click on the screen to complete a series of action. The puzzle is completely nonsensical and logic does no apply in the solution. There are a couple of actions and reactions in 1 scenario but only 1 action works. Even if you successfully complete a scenario, you are still required to try out all possible actions in order to score a gold. When you play, you can select the stage but not the scenarios in the stage. You are only given a couple of second to perform 1 complete possible action with 1 outcome before the game automatically switches to the next scenarion. It will repeat itself until you complete all the scenarions before you can replay the stage again to get gold.  The sound and music system in this game is repetitive and dull. After a while, it really got to my nerve and I decide to play the game in silence.  Personally I think this game fits to be a easter egg in bigger games like GTA or Saints Row where you can engage an arcade machine to play.  Oh and if you are looking to collect the cards, they do drop but at a much slower rate. My first card drop was at the hour mark (approximately there). My total play time includes a couple of minutes fiddling the game and the remaining was to collect cards.  The only thing I liked about this game is that you can change your pixel display style which I think its quite artistic in a way.

0/10 I bought this game out of curiosity. I'm no longer curious, and completing it purely out of stubbornness. The game which Everybody's been talking about this year. Not as bad (or as bad for gaming as a whole) as many say, but not as much fun as others would have you believe. Fun for a while, but some of the solutions and gags make no sense, and will leave you randomly clicking until something happens and you can move on.
Dat myooosik though. Also would probably be a fun game if it actually followed some logic rather than just arbitrary nonsense. Some funny moments though.
Anything can be put on steam nowadays. -.-
Really not worth more than 1 cent. Only played for the trading cards, which it didnt deserved to have...
A trial-and-error game. Boring as hell.

I got this for a buck, and it was probably one of the WORST purchases I've ever made in regards of the usage of one dollar, I'm not kidding. Why?  well here's why: The gameplay, is mediocre,- generally fustrating, and it gets old REAL damn fast. Sometimes,you don't know exactly what to do so you just get desperate (usually) and you click all around the screen hoping that it's somehow the solution to that specific puzzle you're on.That's just dull and irritating.  The visuals. nothing special.Its pixels, what do you expect? And they're not even that detailed, they're like as if someone animated all this crap through mspaint and flash- well might as well be hm?  The music, VERY repititive-I'd rather hear my music instead of bearing to listen to this games.  The 'humor' (dare I say it) is very unfunny,forced, and childish. It's not clever, it's not even really charming. It's just random and stupid. Yeha, there are references to some TVs/Game ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ttery but it really doesn't make up for how down right unhumorous this game is.  I honestly tried to like this game, alas, it all fell flat on its face for me.   If you see this, stay the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ away from it. Even if it's standing at one dollar, trust me- it won't pay itself back at the end of it all. I'ld literally chuck a buck just to get this out of my library. I only say go for it if you're into crummy casual obscure games- because that's basically what it is.

This game isn't all that great. I bought it for $.99 as a cart-topper of sorts while it was on sale, on a mild whim, nothing more.   The game is a point-and-click game mashed with Wario Ware quickness. You get about 5 or 6 seconds (give or take a second or two) to 'Save The Day' and each level has 5 or 6 scenarios in which McPixel must save the day. It tries to be funny and random, but most often for me it just came off as rather, well, dumb.   It's not inherently BAD for what it is, per se, but I wouldn't dare pay full price for this. It's just not really my cup of tea. I mean if you dig point-and-click asthetic and/or WarioWare-esque gameplay, then hell yeah, you'd probably like this.   But me, personally, I really don't like it.

its like click and no click and no click and no click and yes! click and no for like 6 hours straight also the game says stop playing after a few minutes because its only good in bursts and if that doesnt tell you somethings wrong with the game then you have a problem

I finished this game (despite steam having not registered my play time accordingly). Not a good game. It offers a little bit of a unique experience, but I think that the challenges are just too much non-sense and not fun (I love non-sense things, but this one have not pleased me).  Not recommended.  3/10

Funny at the first sight, but gets boring very fast. Not a real game just a good joke.  Edit (to make it more helpful :) It is something like point and click adventure, where you solve one screen puzzles. illogical puzzles. so You will click on everything interactive to see what will happen. Usually it will finish with huge explosion. To make a progress (and see some new puzzles) you have to finish successfully some previous puzzles (well, I know its not a big surprise). So you will have to repeat puzzles and hunting for all interactive spots, what i found boring after few screens. I wanted to run through it like running though comic book at least, but it was not possible. i gave up. Some jokes are better some of them are worse. If you like jokes involving urinating or kicking someone's balls maybe you can find it funny.  If you are considering buying it you might rather watch some gameplay on internet,  or try demo, you will see everything. This application has nothing more to offer.
Not funny and has an annoying repeating sountrack. This game requires no skill apart from to click randomly.

I very seldom down-vote a game, but there is no way I can recommend purchasing this. You're not likely to enjoy this game for long. I read the reviews ahead of time stating that it's more of a joke than a game. 'That's okay!' I thought. 'Jokes are worth paying for!' But that's if the joke is good. Or meatier. This is one juvenile gag repeated ad nauseam. Occasionally, the combinations of selecting/kicking result in a good laugh (usually just a chuckle). The rest...? Do I enjoy sophomoric humor? Probably more than I should, but c'mon. Is there ANYTHING else besides kicking people in the testes and having everything blow up? The free DLC is all the same.  Even if you buy it on sale, run it in the background to get card drops and sell all of them, you won't break even.  In short, if you're really interested in this game, see if a friend has it already and play it for 10 minutes on their account. And maybe get really high before playing. That might help.
If you can get through the tedium and obtuse design, there is some amusement to be had, however little that may be.

I found the game very borring and in some kind very anoying I would rather play fez or the bridge after as they are much better and more fun adventure puzzle games. all in all I feel like this game was a waste of money , it is just not fun to play :( .   I respect people have there own right to judge and I also recormmend they do but play the game with a friend first or find a trial some where first or you can end up very dissatisfied.

I did not think this game would be BAD! For the most part of the game you go around clicking things until the screen says 'YAY U DID EIT'. I find this game VERY boring as your just clicking things! It's no fun and the reactions of you clicking things aren't funny for me, and that's it's selling point. I don't reccomend it.  2/10  Rubbish
No. No. And umm no? Returning Thanks steam :D

Absolutely awful game. Gameplay sucks, graphics suck, style sucks, coding sucks, music isn't too shabby I guess...  I haven't paid anything for this and still feel ripped off! Do not buy. It's atrocious!  Please do not enable developers to get away with low-effort waste like this!

Ten minutes is really all you need to know if this is the game for you. You walk blind into a scenario in which you are to diffuse a stick of dynamite within 20 seconds. The problem is the solution is not based on logic or reason, but point-and-click-adventure-game puzzle rationale that make no sense whatsoever. This may be the 'humor' of the game, but it stops being funny pretty fast, especially since you'll find yourself replaying the same 20 second levels over and over.

Purchased as part of a bundle at some point in the distant past, I'm not a huge fan of the 'rinse and repeat' style of game that you'll see in Super Meat Boy and the hundreds of clones of that style. This game seems to be the worst of that genre, not much to engage the user. Game is so over the top crap quality of annoyance, AVOID.
A very random point & click game with try and error mechanics. While it's sometimes funny I can't fully recommend it. It's just nothing special.
good for a bit of a laugh at the start,but gets pretty boring quick
Why did I waste 3 hours and 5 dollars of my life on this? Oh yeah..... cause im a dumbass. If you like 'Lol Random' humor it's fun, but to me...... just a bad decision.
I needed a game to downvote.
I played this for six trading cards.  No one bought them.  I think I clicked the wrong thing and ♥♥♥♥ blew up for no reason.

McPixel is funny, random, and usually nonsensical fun times in game form.  McPixel is also incredibly short, has almost no replay value, and is ultimately forgetable for $5 (compared to the $3 it goes for on the iOS).  You can literally get the full experience by watching it on Youtube. The extra features you get by finding every possible ending to a level don't really add anything to the game. There is a level editor though so take that as you will.  McPixel just feels better off as a free flash game than a full length (ha) purchase. And that's why I have trouble justifying purchasing it.

What can I say...? Well I kinda knew what I was getting into but... yeah it's bad. Yes it's not supposed to be taken seriously and the nonsensic humor is cool, but the game itself is simply not that good really. Its basically a series of those stupid puzzles in classic adventure games that didn't make any sense. It's just that.  2/5

It is embarrassing to see this game rated 76/100. It is not worth more than 1h of gameplay...there is not even a gameplay and you have to random click around and see what happens. Even with the 75% discount (with wich i bought it)  I DON'T reccomend it. Look around for better games than this one

Alot of the game is just randomness. But, if that's the kind of stuff you like then I HIGHLY recommend this game. However, if you already saw Pewdiepie or someone else play it, then there's really nothing here to spend you're money on because you'll get the same thing everytme you play it. The game would be more interesting to play if the right choices were logical and they made you think, but because this game is so random it's just a bunch of trial and error and eventually that stops being fun.
If you have down syndrome, you will like this game.
Only bought this to get cards. Other than that it sucks.
This is quite possibly the worst 'game' I have ever played. It's just a 'LOL SO RANDUM' point-and-click with no logic or real entertainment value at all.
If you have down syndrome, you will like this game.
It's crass and the pixel art is ugly.

What can I say...? Well I kinda knew what I was getting into but... yeah it's bad. Its basically a series of those stupid puzzles in classic adventure games that didn't make any sense. It's just that.  2/5
